controls.title: Account Management
controls.label: Account Management (03.01.01)
controls.statement:
SR-03.01.01.a Define the types of system accounts allowed and prohibited.
SR-03.01.01.b Create, enable, modify, disable, and remove system accounts in accordance with policy, procedures, prerequisites, and criteria.
SR-03.01.01.c Specify:
SR-03.01.01.c.01 Authorized users of the system,
SR-03.01.01.c.02 Group and role membership, and
SR-03.01.01.c.03 Access authorizations (i.e., privileges) for each account.
SR-03.01.01.d Authorize access to the system based on:
SR-03.01.01.d.01 A valid access authorization and
SR-03.01.01.d.02 Intended system usage.
SR-03.01.01.e Monitor the use of system accounts.
SR-03.01.01.f Disable system accounts when:
SR-03.01.01.f.01 The accounts have expired,
SR-03.01.01.f.02 The accounts have been inactive for {{ insert: param, A.03.01.01.ODP.01 }},
SR-03.01.01.f.03 The accounts are no longer associated with a user or individual,
SR-03.01.01.f.04 The accounts are in violation of organizational policy, or
SR-03.01.01.f.05 Significant risks associated with individuals are discovered.
SR-03.01.01.g Notify account managers and designated personnel or roles within:
SR-03.01.01.g.01 {{ insert: param, A.03.01.01.ODP.02 }} when accounts are no longer required.
SR-03.01.01.g.02 {{ insert: param, A.03.01.01.ODP.03 }} when users are terminated or transferred.
SR-03.01.01.g.03 {{ insert: param, A.03.01.01.ODP.04 }} when system usage or the need-to-know changes for an individual.
SR-03.01.01.h Require that users log out of the system after {{ insert: param, A.03.01.01.ODP.05 }} of expected inactivity or when {{ insert: param, A.03.01.01.ODP.06 }}.

objectives.prose: system accounts are created in accordance with organizational policy, procedures, prerequisites, and criteria.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.01.01.b.01

objectives.prose: system accounts are enabled in accordance with organizational policy, procedures, prerequisites, and criteria.

controls.title: Separation of Duties
controls.label: Separation of Duties (03.01.04)
controls.statement: \nSR-03.01.04.a Identify the duties of individuals requiring separation.\nSR-03.01.04.b Define system access authorizations to support separation of duties.

controls.title: Least Privilege
controls.label: Least Privilege (03.01.05)
controls.statement:
SR-03.01.05.a Allow only authorized system access for users (or processes acting on behalf of users) that is necessary to accomplish assigned organizational tasks.
SR-03.01.05.b Authorize access to {{ insert: param, A.03.01.05.ODP.01 }} and {{ insert: param, A.03.01.05.ODP.02 }}.
SR-03.01.05.c Review the privileges assigned to roles or classes of users {{ insert: param, A.03.01.05.ODP.03 }} to validate the need for such privileges.
SR-03.01.05.d Reassign or remove privileges, as necessary.

objectives.prose: system access for users (or processes acting on behalf of users) is authorized only when necessary to accomplish assigned organizational tasks.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.01.05.a

objectives.prose: access to {{ insert: param, A.03.01.05.ODP.01 }} is authorized.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.01.05.b.01

objectives.prose: access to {{ insert: param, A.03.01.05.ODP.02 }} is authorized.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.01.05.b.02

objectives.prose: privileges are reassigned or removed, as necessary.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.01.05.d

controls.title: Least Privilege – Privileged Accounts
controls.label: Least Privilege – Privileged Accounts (03.01.06)
controls.statement: \nSR-03.01.06.a Restrict privileged accounts on the system to {{ insert: param, A.03.01.06.ODP.01 }}..\nSR-03.01.06.b Require that users (or roles) with privileged accounts use non-privileged accounts when accessing non-security functions or non-security information.

objectives.prose: privileged accounts on the system are restricted to {{ insert: param, A.03.01.06.ODP.01 }}.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.01.06.a

objectives.prose: users (or roles) with privileged accounts are required to use non-privileged accounts when accessing non-security functions or non-security information.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.01.06.b

controls.title: Least Privilege – Privileged Functions
controls.label: Least Privilege – Privileged Functions (03.01.07)
controls.statement: \nSR-03.01.07.a Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.\nSR-03.01.07.b Log the execution of privileged functions.

objectives.prose: the execution of privileged functions is logged.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.01.07.b

objectives.prose: non-privileged users are prevented from executing privileged functions.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.01.07.a

controls.title: Unsuccessful Logon Attempts
controls.label: Unsuccessful Logon Attempts (03.01.08)
controls.statement: \nSR-03.01.08.a Enforce a limit of {{ insert: param, A.03.01.08.ODP.01 }} consecutive invalid logon attempts by a user during a {{ insert: param, A.03.01.08.ODP.02 }}.\nSR-03.01.08.b Automatically {{ insert: param, A.03.01.08.ODP.03 }} when the maximum number of unsuccessful attempts is exceeded.

objectives.prose: a limit of {{ insert: param, A.03.01.08.ODP.01 }} consecutive invalid logon attempts by a user during {{ insert: param, A.03.01.08.ODP.02 }} is enforced.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.01.08.a

objectives.prose: {{ insert: param, A.03.01.08.ODP.03 }} when the maximum number of unsuccessful attempts is exceeded.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.01.08.b

objectives.prose: a system use notification message with privacy and security notices consistent with applicable CUI rules is displayed before granting access to the system.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.01.09

controls.title: Device Lock
controls.label: Device Lock (03.01.10)
controls.statement:
SR-03.01.10.a Prevent access to the system by {{ insert: param, A.03.01.10.ODP.01 }}.
SR-03.01.10.b Retain the device lock until the user reestablishes access using established identification and authentication procedures.
SR-03.01.10.c Conceal, via the device lock, information previously visible on the display with a publicly viewable image.

objectives.prose: access to the system is prevented by {{ insert: param, A.03.01.10.ODP.01 }}.

objectives.prose: information previously visible on the display is concealed via device lock with a publicly viewable image.

objectives.prose: the device lock is retained until the user reestablishes access using established identification and authentication procedures.

controls.title: Remote Access
controls.label: Remote Access (03.01.12)
controls.statement:
SR-03.01.12.a Establish usage restrictions, configuration requirements, and connection requirements for each type of allowable remote system access.
SR-03.01.12.b Authorize each type of remote system access prior to establishing such connections.
SR-03.01.12.c Route remote access to the system through authorized and managed access control points.
SR-03.01.12.d Authorize the remote execution of privileged commands and remote access to security-relevant information.

objectives.prose: types of allowable remote system access are defined.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.01.12.a.01

objectives.prose: usage restrictions are established for each type of allowable remote system access.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.01.12.a.02

objectives.prose: configuration requirements are established for each type of allowable remote system access.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.01.12.a.03

objectives.prose: connection requirements are established for each type of allowable remote system access.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.01.12.a.04

objectives.prose: each type of remote system access is authorized prior to establishing such connections.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.01.12.b

objectives.prose: remote access to the system is routed through authorized access control points.

controls.title: Wireless Access
controls.label: Wireless Access (03.01.16)
controls.statement:
SR-03.01.16.a Establish usage restrictions, configuration requirements, and connection requirements for each type of wireless access to the system.
SR-03.01.16.b Authorize each type of wireless access to the system prior to establishing such connections.
SR-03.01.16.c Disable, when not intended for use, wireless networking capabilities prior to issuance and deployment.
SR-03.01.16.d Protect wireless access to the system using authentication and encryption.

objectives.prose: each type of wireless access to the system is authorized prior to establishing such connections.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.01.16.b

objectives.prose: wireless networking capabilities not intended for use are disabled prior to issuance and deployment.

objectives.prose: wireless access to the system is protected using authentication.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.01.16.d.01

objectives.prose: wireless access to the system is protected using encryption.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.01.16.d.02

controls.title: Access Control for Mobile Devices
controls.label: Access Control for Mobile Devices (03.01.18)
controls.statement:
SR-03.01.18.a Establish usage restrictions, configuration requirements, and connection requirements for mobile devices.
SR-03.01.18.b Authorize the connection of mobile devices to the system.
SR-03.01.18.c Implement full-device or container-based encryption to protect the confidentiality of CUI on mobile devices.

objectives.prose: usage restrictions are established for mobile devices.

objectives.prose: configuration requirements are established for mobile devices.

objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.01.18.b

objectives.prose: full-device or container-based encryption is implemented to protect the confidentiality of CUI on mobile devices.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.01.18.c

controls.title: Use of External Systems
controls.label: Use of External Systems (03.01.20)
controls.statement:
SR-03.01.20.a Prohibit the use of external systems unless the systems are specifically authorized.
SR-03.01.20.b Establish the following security requirements to be satisfied on external systems prior to allowing use of or access to those systems by authorized individuals: {{ insert: param, A.03.01.20.ODP.01 }}.
SR-03.01.20.c Permit authorized individuals to use external systems to access the organizational system or to process, store, or transmit CUI only after:
SR-03.01.20.c.01 Verifying that the security requirements on the external systems as specified in the organization’s system security plans have been satisfied and
SR-03.01.20.c.02 Retaining approved system connection or processing agreements with the organizational entities hosting the external systems.
SR-03.01.20.d Restrict the use of organization-controlled portable storage devices by authorized individuals on external systems.

objectives.prose: the following security requirements to be satisfied on external systems prior to allowing the use of or access to those systems by authorized individuals are established: {{ insert: param, A.03.01.20.ODP.01 }}.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.01.20.b

objectives.prose: the use of external systems is prohibited unless the systems are specifically authorized.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.01.20.a

objectives.prose: authorized individuals are permitted to use external systems to access the organizational system or to process, store, or transmit CUI only after verifying that the security requirements on the external systems as specified in the organization’s system security plans have been satisfied.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.01.20.c.01

objectives.prose: the use of organization-controlled portable storage devices by authorized individuals on external systems is restricted.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.01.20.d

objectives.prose: authorized individuals are permitted to use external systems to access the organizational system or to process, store, or transmit CUI only after retaining approved system connection or processing agreements with the organizational entity hosting the external systems.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.01.20.c.02

controls.title: Publicly Accessible Content
controls.label: Publicly Accessible Content (03.01.22)
controls.statement: \nSR-03.01.22.a Train authorized individuals to ensure that publicly accessible information does not contain CUI.\nSR-03.01.22.b Review the content on publicly accessible systems for CUI and remove such information, if discovered.

objectives.prose: authorized individuals are trained to ensure that publicly accessible information does not contain CUI.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.01.22.a

objectives.prose: the content on publicly accessible systems is reviewed for CUI.

objectives.prose: CUI is removed from publicly accessible systems, if discovered.

controls.label: Literacy Training and Awareness (03.02.01)
controls.statement:
SR-03.02.01.a Provide security literacy training to system users:
SR-03.02.01.a.01 As part of initial training for new users and {{ insert: param, A.03.02.01.ODP.01 }} thereafter,
SR-03.02.01.a.02 When required by system changes or following {{ insert: param, A.03.02.01.ODP.02 }}, and
SR-03.02.01.a.03 On recognizing and reporting indicators of insider threat, social engineering, and social mining.
SR-03.02.01.b Update security literacy training content {{ insert: param, A.03.02.01.ODP.03 }} and following {{ insert: param, A.03.02.01.ODP.04 }}.

controls.title: Event Logging
controls.label: Event Logging (03.03.01)
controls.statement: \nSR-03.03.01.a Specify the following event types selected for logging within the system: {{ insert: param, A.03.03.01.ODP.01 }}.\nSR-03.03.01.b Review and update the event types selected for logging {{ insert: param, A.03.03.01.ODP.02 }}.

controls.title: Audit Record Content
controls.label: Audit Record Content (03.03.02)
controls.statement:
SR-03.03.02.a Include the following content in audit records:
SR-03.03.02.a.01 What type of event occurred
SR-03.03.02.a.02 When the event occurred
SR-03.03.02.a.03 Where the event occurred
SR-03.03.02.a.04 Source of the event
SR-03.03.02.a.05 Outcome of the event
SR-03.03.02.a.06 Identity of the individuals, subjects, objects, or entities associated with the event
SR-03.03.02.b Provide additional information for audit records as needed.

objectives.prose: audit records contain information that establishes what type of event occurred.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.03.02.a.01

objectives.prose: audit records contain information that establishes when the event occurred.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.03.02.a.02

objectives.prose: audit records contain information that establishes where the event occurred.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.03.02.a.03

objectives.prose: audit records contain information that establishes the source of the event.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.03.02.a.04

objectives.prose: audit records contain information that establishes the outcome of the event.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.03.02.a.05

objectives.prose: audit records contain information that establishes the identity of the individuals, subjects, objects, or entities associated with the event.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.03.02.a.06

objectives.prose: additional information for audit records is provided, as needed.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.03.02.b

controls.title: Audit Record Generation
controls.label: Audit Record Generation (03.03.03)
controls.statement: \nSR-03.03.03.a Generate audit records for the selected event types and audit record content specified in 03.03.01 and 03.03.02.\nSR-03.03.03.b Retain audit records for a time period consistent with the records retention policy.

objectives.prose: audit records for the selected event types and audit record content specified in 03.03.01 and 03.03.02 are generated.

controls.title: Incident Response Plan
controls.label: Incident Response Plan (03.06.05)
controls.statement:
SR-03.06.05.a Develop an incident response plan that:
SR-03.06.05.a.01 Provides the organization with a roadmap for implementing its incident response capability,
SR-03.06.05.a.02 Describes the structure and organization of the incident response capability,
SR-03.06.05.a.03 Provides a high-level approach for how the incident response capability fits into the overall organization,
SR-03.06.05.a.04 Defines reportable incidents,
SR-03.06.05.a.05 Addresses the sharing of incident information, and
SR-03.06.05.a.06 Designates responsibilities to organizational entities, personnel, or roles.
SR-03.06.05.b Distribute copies of the incident response plan to designated incident response personnel (identified by name and/or by role) and organizational elements.
SR-03.06.05.c Update the incident response plan to address system and organizational changes or problems encountered during plan implementation, execution, or testing.
SR-03.06.05.d Protect the incident response plan from unauthorized disclosure.

objectives.prose: an incident response plan is developed that provides the organization with a roadmap for implementing its incident response capability.

controls.title: Maintenance Tools

controls.statement:

SR-03.07.04.b Check media with diagnostic and test programs for malicious code before it is used in the system.
SR-03.07.04.c Prevent the removal of system maintenance equipment containing CUI by verifying that there is no CUI on the equipment, sanitizing or destroying the equipment, or retaining the equipment within the facility.

controls.title: Personnel Termination and Transfer
controls.label: Personnel Termination and Transfer (03.09.02)
controls.statement:
SR-03.09.02.a When individual employment is terminated:
SR-03.09.02.a.01 Disable system access within {{ insert: param, A.03.09.02.ODP.01 }},
SR-03.09.02.a.02 Terminate or revoke authenticators and credentials associated with the individual, and
SR-03.09.02.a.03 Retrieve security-related system property.
SR-03.09.02.b When individuals are reassigned or transferred to other positions in the organization:
SR-03.09.02.b.01 Review and confirm the ongoing operational need for current logical and physical access authorizations to the system and facility, and
SR-03.09.02.b.02 Modify access authorization to correspond with any changes in operational need.

objectives.prose: upon individual reassignment or transfer to other positions in the organization, access authorization is modified to correspond with any changes in operational need.

controls.title: Physical Access Control
controls.label: Physical Access Control (03.10.07)
controls.statement:
SR-03.10.07.a Enforce physical access authorizations at entry and exit points to the facility where the system resides by:
SR-03.10.07.a.01 Verifying individual physical access authorizations before granting access to the facility and
SR-03.10.07.a.02 Controlling ingress and egress with physical access control systems, devices, or guards.
SR-03.10.07.b Maintain physical access audit logs for entry or exit points.
SR-03.10.07.c Escort visitors, and control visitor activity.
SR-03.10.07.d Secure keys, combinations, and other physical access devices.
SR-03.10.07.e Control physical access to output devices to prevent unauthorized individuals from obtaining access to CUI.

objectives.prose: physical access authorizations are enforced at entry and exit points to the facility where the system resides by verifying individual physical access authorizations before granting access.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.10.07.a.01

controls.title: Boundary Protection
controls.label: Boundary Protection (03.13.01)
controls.statement:
SR-03.13.01.a Monitor and control communications at external managed interfaces to the system and key internal managed interfaces within the system.
SR-03.13.01.b Implement subnetworks for publicly accessible system components that are physically or logically separated from internal networks.
SR-03.13.01.c Connect to external systems only through managed interfaces that consist of boundary protection devices arranged in accordance with an organizational security architecture.

objectives.prose: communications at external managed interfaces to the system are monitored.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.13.01.a.01

objectives.prose: communications at external managed interfaces to the system are controlled.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.13.01.a.02

objectives.prose: communications at key internal managed interfaces within the system are monitored.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.13.01.a.03

objectives.prose: communications at key internal managed interfaces within the system are controlled.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.13.01.a.04

objectives.prose: subnetworks are implemented for publicly accessible system components that are physically or logically separated from internal networks.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.13.01.b

objectives.prose: external system connections are only made through managed interfaces that consist of boundary protection devices arranged in accordance with an organizational security architecture.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.13.01.c

objectives.prose: unauthorized information transfer via shared system resources is prevented.

objectives.prose: unintended information transfer via shared system resources is prevented.

objectives.prose: network communications traffic is allowed by exception.

controls.label: Collaborative Computing Devices and Applications (03.13.12)
controls.statement: \nSR-03.13.12.a Prohibit the remote activation of collaborative computing devices and applications with the following exceptions: {{ insert: param, A.03.13.12.ODP.01 }}.\nSR-03.13.12.b Provide an explicit indication of use to users physically present at the devices.

controls.statement: \nSR-03.13.13.a Define acceptable mobile code and mobile code technologies.\nSR-03.13.13.b Authorize, monitor, and control the use of mobile code.

controls.title: Flaw Remediation
controls.label: Flaw Remediation (03.14.01)
controls.statement: \nSR-03.14.01.a Identify, report, and correct system flaws.\nSR-03.14.01.b Install security-relevant software and firmware updates within {{ insert: param, A.03.14.01.ODP.01 }} of the release of the updates.

controls.title: Malicious Code Protection
controls.label: Malicious Code Protection (03.14.02)
controls.statement:
SR-03.14.02.a Implement malicious code protection mechanisms at system entry and exit points to detect and eradicate malicious code.
SR-03.14.02.b Update malicious code protection mechanisms as new releases are available in accordance with configuration management policies and procedures.
SR-03.14.02.c Configure malicious code protection mechanisms to:
SR-03.14.02.c.01 Perform scans of the system {{ insert: param, A.03.14.02.ODP.01 }} and real-time scans of files from external sources at endpoints or system entry and exit points as the files are downloaded, opened, or executed; and
SR-03.14.02.c.02 Block malicious code, quarantine malicious code, or take other mitigation actions in response to malicious code detection.

objectives.prose: malicious code protection mechanisms are implemented at system entry and exit points to detect malicious code.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.14.02.a.01

objectives.prose: malicious code protection mechanisms are implemented at system entry and exit points to eradicate malicious code.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.14.02.a.02

objectives.prose: malicious code protection mechanisms are updated as new releases are available in accordance with configuration management policy and procedures.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.14.02.b

objectives.prose: malicious code protection mechanisms are configured to perform scans of the system {{ insert: param, A.03.14.02.ODP.01 }}.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.14.02.c.01.01

objectives.prose: malicious code protection mechanisms are configured to block malicious code, quarantine malicious code, or take other actions in response to malicious code detection.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.14.02.c.02

objectives.prose: malicious code protection mechanisms are configured to perform real-time scans of files from external sources at endpoints or system entry and exit points as the files are downloaded, opened, or executed.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.14.02.c.01.02

controls.statement: \nSR-03.14.03.a Receive system security alerts, advisories, and directives from external organizations on an ongoing basis.\nSR-03.14.03.b Generate and disseminate internal system security alerts, advisories, and directives, as necessary.

controls.title: System Monitoring
controls.label: System Monitoring (03.14.06)
controls.statement:
SR-03.14.06.a Monitor the system to detect:
SR-03.14.06.a.01 Attacks and indicators of potential attacks and
SR-03.14.06.a.02 Unauthorized connections.
SR-03.14.06.b Identify unauthorized use of the system.
SR-03.14.06.c Monitor inbound and outbound communications traffic to detect unusual or unauthorized activities or conditions.

objectives.prose: the system is monitored to detect attacks.

objectives.prose: inbound communications traffic is monitored to detect unusual or unauthorized activities or conditions.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.14.06.c.01

objectives.prose: outbound communications traffic is monitored to detect unusual or unauthorized activities or conditions.
objectives.label: assessment-objective_DS-A.03.14.06.c.02

controls.title: Rules of Behavior
controls.label: Rules of Behavior (03.15.03)
controls.statement:
SR-03.15.03.a Establish rules that describe the responsibilities and expected behavior for system usage and protecting CUI.
SR-03.15.03.b Provide rules to individuals who require access to the system.
SR-03.15.03.c Receive a documented acknowledgement from individuals indicating that they have read, understand, and agree to abide by the rules of behavior before authorizing access to CUI and the system.
SR-03.15.03.d Review and update the rules of behavior {{ insert: param, A.03.15.03.ODP.01 }}.

controls.statement: \nSR-03.16.02.a Replace system components when support for the components is no longer available from the developer, vendor, or manufacturer.\nSR-03.16.02.b Provide options for risk mitigation or alternative sources for continued support for unsupported components that cannot be replaced.

controls.title: External System Services
controls.label: External System Services (03.16.03)
controls.statement:
SR-03.16.03.a Require the providers of external system services used for the processing, storage, or transmission of CUI to comply with the following security requirements: {{ insert: param, A.03.16.03.ODP.01 }}.
SR-03.16.03.b Define and document user roles and responsibilities with regard to external system services, including shared responsibilities with external service providers.
SR-03.16.03.c Implement processes, methods, and techniques to monitor security requirement compliance by external service providers on an ongoing basis.
